head.title: Metro Briefing | New York: Manhattan: Compliance With Tobacco Laws Rises

hedline.hl1: Metro Briefing | New York: Manhattan: Compliance With Tobacco Laws Rises

block.p: Nearly 9 out of 10 New York City businesses obey laws forbidding the sale of tobacco to people under the age of 18, city officials said yesterday. In the most recent round of inspections, investigators for the Department of Consumer Affairs found that 89 percent of businesses licensed to sell tobacco in New York check for identification and refuse to sell to minors, said Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg. The department spot-checks businesses across the city using teams of inspectors and teenage workers. When the program started in 1998, 52 percent of businesses followed the rules, officials said.
